title: Something wrong in time.Parse()
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
    1.6.2 

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
    windows 10/amd64

3. What did you do?
If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error.
A complete runnable program is good.
A link on play.golang.org is best.

    I was learning golang this week.When I using time.Parse() to format time string,I tried "2006-01-02      15:04:09"~"2006-01-02 15:04:00" for fun.I fund some bugs in this function,but I can't fix them...Sorry...
    You can see the program in  [play.golang.org](https://play.golang.org/p/c2Yqa5tRZa)

4. What did you expect to see?
    Can we use "Y-m-d" for the layout ?

5. What did you see instead?
